ticket.title: fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects
ticket.original-body: This patch allows to use subselects in the finder_sql without specifing the counter_sql which was impossible because the regex was too greedy. The patch fixes this issue for has_many, has_many :through and has_and_belongs_to_many. Tests included.
ticket.latest-body: This patch allows to use subselects in the finder_sql without specifing the counter_sql which was impossible because the regex was too greedy. The patch fixes this issue for has_many, has_many :through and has_and_belongs_to_many. Tests included.
ticket.original-body-html: This patch allows to use subselects in the finder_sql without specifing the counter_sql which was impossible because the regex was too greedy. The patch fixes this issue for has_many, has_many :through and has_and_belongs_to_many. Tests included.

version.body: This patch allows to use subselects in the finder_sql without specifing the counter_sql which was impossible because the regex was too greedy. The patch fixes this issue for has_many, has_many :through and has_and_belongs_to_many. Tests included.
version.body-html:
This patch allows to use subselects in the finder_sql without specifing the counter_sql which was impossible because the regex was too greedy. The patch fixes this issue for has_many, has_many :through and has_and_belongs_to_many.
Tests included.
version.title: fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects

version.body:
Hey,
The patch doesn't apply cleanly. Also, could you please fix your email in the patch ?
@@@ git config --global user.name "Your Name" git config --global user.email your_email@your-domain.com @@@
version.body-html:
Hey,

The patch doesn't apply cleanly. Also, could you please fix your email in the patch ?

git config --global user.name "Your Name"
git config --global user.email your_email@your-domain.com
version.title: fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects
fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects

version.body:
Hey Kane,
The tests fail on sqlite3. I think the test should be skipped for adapters not supporting subqueries.
Thanks!
version.body-html:
Hey Kane,

The tests fail on sqlite3. I think the test should be skipped for adapters not supporting subqueries.

Thanks!
version.title: fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects

version.body:
are there adapters which dont support subqueries?
I changed the sql, now works with sqlite3 and should not be adapter specific.
hope this is the final version^^
version.body-html:
are there adapters which dont support subqueries?

I changed the sql, now works with sqlite3 and should not be adapter specific.

hope this is the final version^^
version.title: fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects

version.body:
The test still fails for me on sqlite3.
@@@ 1) Error: test_counting_from_finder_sql_with_subselect(HasManyAssociationsTest): ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid: SQLite3::SQLException: near ")": syntax error: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM companies LIMIT 1) IS NOT NULL; ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract_adapter.rb:214:in `log' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/sqlite_adapter.rb:168:in `execute_without_query_record' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/sqlite_adapter.rb:413:in `catch_schema_changes' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/sqlite_adapter.rb:168:in `execute_without_query_record' ./cases/helper.rb:41:in `execute' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/sqlite_adapter.rb:316:in `select' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract/database_statements.rb:7:in `select_all_without_query_cache' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract/query_cache.rb:62:in `select_all' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract/database_statements.rb:13:in `select_one' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract/database_statements.rb:19:in `select_value' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/base.rb:956:in `count_by_sql' ./cases/../../lib/active_record/associations/association_collection.rb:169:in `count' cases/associations/has_many_associations_test.rb:36:in `test_counting_from_finder_sql_with_subselect' ./cases/../../lib/../../activemodel/lib/../../activesupport/lib/active_support/testing/setup_and_teardown.rb:62:in `__send__' ./cases/../../lib/../../activemodel/lib/../../activesupport/lib/active_support/testing/setup_and_teardown.rb:62:in `run' @@@
version.body-html:
The test still fails for me on sqlite3.

  1) Error:
test_counting_from_finder_sql_with_subselect(HasManyAssociationsTest):
ActiveRecord::StatementInvalid: SQLite3::SQLException: near ")": syntax error: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM companies LIMIT 1) IS NOT NULL;

    ./cases/helper.rb:41:in `execute'

    ./cases/../../lib/active_record/connection_adapters/abstract/database_statements.rb:19:in `select_value'
    ./cases/../../lib/active_record/base.rb:956:in `count_by_sql'
    ./cases/../../lib/active_record/associations/association_collection.rb:169:in `count'

version.title: fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects

version.body:
i rebased and removed a conflict.
also 2 other developers tried my patch and they got no error. i have no idea why its failing on your machine.
tested on: windows xp, ruby 1.8.6, sqlite3-ruby 1.2.5 with sqlite 3.5.6 ubuntu, ruby 1.9.1, sqlite3-ruby 1.2.4 with sqlite 3.6.10
version.body-html:
i rebased and removed a conflict.

also 2 other developers tried my patch and they got no error.
i have no idea why its failing on your machine.

tested on:
windows xp, ruby 1.8.6, sqlite3-ruby 1.2.5 with sqlite 3.5.6
ubuntu, ruby 1.9.1, sqlite3-ruby 1.2.4 with sqlite 3.6.10

version.body:
@Kane can you provide an example of "subselects in the finder_sql" so I could fully understand the problem this patch is solving. If I understand it then I can write a test for your patch.
Thanks

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.body-html:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.

The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.

Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
version.title: fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects
fixed counter_sql from finder_sql to work with subselects
